oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Notarized affadavit concerning Civil War service of Elihu Pierce
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. Elihu P. Pierce, who served as Asst. Surgeon, 6th N. H. Inf., USA, during the Civil War, had this form notarized by Henry Abbot, a signature certified by Edward Farrar, Clerk of the Supreme Judicial Court of New Hampshire. It stated that Pierce was not indebted to the U.S. for pay or equipment, nor had been absent without leave. The reverse side lists a servant, George E. Alexander. Pierce states that the last payment he received from the Army Paymaster was July 30, 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
